alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:22AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN GUERNSEY...SOUTHWESTERN COSHOCTON...MUSKINGUM AND WESTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 122 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hanover to near Shawnee. Movement was southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Cambridge, Caldwell, New Concord, Byesville, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Dudley, Philo, and Pleasant Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio near mile marker 143, and between mile markers 145 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 19 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east central Ohio.
